content.title: Neurofibromatosis Type 1 Vasculopathy (NF1)
content.description: Vascular complications of neurofibromatosis type 1, including arterial stenosis, aneurysms, and arteriovenous malformations affecting various vascular beds.
content.definition: NF1 vasculopathy refers to the spectrum of vascular abnormalities occurring in patients with NF1 (mutation in NF1 gene encoding neurofibromin). Manifestations include renal artery stenosis causing hypertension, cerebrovascular moyamoya-like changes, aneurysms, and vessel wall fragility complicating surgical intervention.

genetic_basis: Mutation in NF1 gene on chromosome 17q11.2
vascular_manifestations: Renal artery stenosis (most common vascular issue)
surveillance_recommendations: Blood pressure monitoring at all visits
Consider renal artery imaging if hypertensive

learning_objectives: Recognize renal artery stenosis as common finding
clinical_pearls: Renal artery stenosis is most common vascular manifestation
Vessel fragility makes angioplasty and surgery challenging
Moyamoya in NF1 has high stroke risk
Always assess BP in NF1 patients - renovascular HTN common
